author: Slidebean
description:
AI models can now generate sentences from brain activity a medical leap with ethical risks.

A Japanese team has demonstrated technology that converts brain activity into coherent sentence level captions.

The potential benefits for patients with stroke, paralysis, or communication disorders are enormous.

But the breakthrough also raises difficult questions about privacy, consent, and cognitive freedom.

As neural AI advances, society will need guardrails that protect both medical innovation and mental autonomy.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: This AI reads your brain literally

author: Slidebean
description:
Black Mirror is now a startup: meet your AI clone.

Iteros just rebranded to UR.AI, raising $10M to build an AI copy of you not when you die, but right now.

You answer hours of personal questions, and it recreates your personality.
Congrats: the future includes you and AI you. 😬

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: A startup now lets you create an AI version of yourself before you die

author: Slidebean
description:
The UK built an AI that competes with GPT-5 and apologizes while doing it.

Local Loki Labs has introduced Loka, a general purpose AI assistant backed by its own large language model.

The company emphasizes privacy, non U.S. data routing, and an AI system aligned with “British values.”

As global competition intensifies, Loka represents a growing trend of countries developing culturally aligned, locally hosted AI alternatives, reshaping the geopolitical landscape of artificial intelligence.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: London’s Loka enters the race against GPT-5 with a “British-aligned” LLM.
